items.content:
Hey Frankie, can you ask the advertiser if they obtained their theme from the Shopify theme store, or if it's a custom theme?


Shopify is able to identify actions taken on advertisers' sites that use their themes with ease, but it may be difficult to capture events, such as Add to Cart, when a theme or certain components (like a button's text) is customized. After we hear back, that will help deduce where the issue is sourced from.


Thanks!
Just asked!
Hi Joey - they confirmed they use a custom theme

Thanks for confirming that, Frankie!


Our integration works flawlessly with templates provided by Shopify. It's not uncommon for custom or third-party themes to throw things off by not triggering the correct Shopify events, which is what eventually triggers TikTok events. For example, below is a screenshot of network calls from a Shopify test store, which uses a theme developed by Shopify that adheres to all their conventions:

By contrast, Rhode's theme does not trigger any of the produce_batch objects that ultimately trigger the TikTok events, so they could possibly be using a plugin for AddToCart (or custom code), which is not following the above convention:


I would have them find out the following:

  • Are they using some sort of plugin, specifically, one that is used for adding items to cart? If it turns out they are using a plugin, then they should probably get in touch with the vendor about this to bring it to their attention.
  • Is there any custom work done on the add to cart button? If so, then they would probably want their developers to look at this and adjust the trigger/logic to adhere to how it functions on standard themes.Â 


Both of the above situations would require developers to do javascript work to get their button to work.
hi joey! just confirmed with the client - they push and update on the site today to try to solve this issue. Are you able to audit or do we need to wait a few days?
I'll be able to take a look today, will follow up this afternoon!
thank you!

We're receiving ATC events and the data within them is looking good! The only thing to call out here is that ATC events are not being deduplicated (currently at a 1% rate):

If they can share more on how they implemented ATC events, I can provide more prescriptive guidance, but generally they need to ensure event_id matches across both browser and server events for successful deduplication.

I'm currently seeing browser events firing on a much more frequent cadence compared to server-side events; ideally, these would fire on a 1:1 ratio. I attached the most recent 2,000 ATC events for their reference to help with QA. LMK if they have any questions here!
thank you!!! just sent this over to the team and asked for more insights!
Awesome, keep me posted!

Hi Joey! From Rhodes Dev Team - 



âAccording to Tiktok documentation, we should use the same event_id value for both the server side and the browser side.

Can we confirm if they're using any API/server-side implementation?

The other option is using their cookie (which is already in place)


Screenshot 2024-02-26 at 1.26.35â¯PM.png

Here's the documentation that mentions both options.

https://business-api.tiktok.com/portal/docs?id=1771100965992450

We can also add an event_id to test if needed, let us know if you want us to try or better to check with tiktok team.â

Hey Frankie, I do see server-side events coming through for ATC events, and it does look like some of them are being deduplicated:

And they are correct in that event_id is one way events can be deduplicated, and requires that the event_id value match across browser and server events. While the ttp cookie is a viable option, I would recommend that event_id since that isn't dependent on a user's cookie consent.Â 


Here are some important callouts using the ttp cookie approach:

  • Cookie deduplication will only drop events sent from Events API, specifically, if there is a browser pixel event of the same [pixelCode, event, _ttp] received 5 minutes or less prior to the receiving of the server event. Cookie deduplication will never drop any event sent from the browser pixel.
  • Cookie deduplication will only drop Events API event when event_id is not set in the Events API payload. Therefore, if you want to leverage cookie based deduplication, do not send event_id in the Events API payload for an event.
thanks - passing this along!

Hi Joey!! From Rhode -Â 

My initial doubt was related to "server side" events since we're not doing any of them. Guessing that they're comingÂ from the Shopify/TikTok app integration.
That beingÂ said, we're sending events using Javascript (client side).


If we add the event_id param following the documentation instructions, should it work?Â 


Just curious to know if we might encounter any bigger issue since the event_id will be randomly generated on page load.

Hey Frankie, yes event_id should work following the documentation, as long as the server-side event's event_id can be orchestrated and match up to its corresponding browser-side event's event_id value.

I wanted to share with you a preview theme were we implemented the direction provided above:

Preview theme for testing: 
Step 1:

https://rhodeskin.myshopify.com/?preview_theme_id=139403133166

Step 2: We tested using the TikTok pixel helper and we see the data coming correctly but I would like your team to final approve it before pushing this work live.

Hey Frankie, I'm seeing event_id come through on their preview theme successfully:

Are they also sending server-side events for this preview theme as well? I'm unable to QA what the event_id is for those server-side events since the pixel helper only works for browser, but if they implemented the event_id 1:1 with the browser ATC events, then deduplication should work successfully.Â

Hi Joey! From Rhode's dev team - "We only did it for browser events. Our understanding is that the Server side events should be sent by Tiktok integration which we do not have access to.

Can you please confirm? "


Are they confused? do we need to set up a call?

Something strikes me as a bit odd since there are server-side events coming through the Shopify integration, but are coming through very infrequently. Between 3/4-3/11, there are roughly 800 deduplicated browser- and server-side events that were created from the Shopify integration. This is less than 1% of the total ATC events, and I assume the remaining 99% of ATC events were triggered from the code that their dev team set up:

When the Shopify integration works fine but is broken in one instance (in this case, it's ATC events), this usually is a sign of erratic behavior from older Pixels created through the Shopify integration, and/or older Pixels that were created via Shopify, but shared with another advertiser account (which is the case for this advertiser):

I'm going to chat with my team and confirm the best next steps. In this case, it's usually disconnecting and setting up a new Pixel through the Rhode advertiser account instead of continuing use of the shared Pixel, but I will follow up with confirmation on how the client should proceed.
Thank you!!

Hey Frankie, we'd ideally first try what we can to have them implement ATC events through the integration, and troubleshoot the infrequent firing of ATC events from the integration. If all else fails, we can explore event deduplication setup which may be a bit trickier to sync up with server-side since those server-side events are firing very infrequently. Can you request that the client does the following?

  • Remove whatever custom code they implemented to track add to cart
  • Disable rebuy (just temporarily) to see if it resolves the issue?
Hi @joey! They are still having a lot of issues - can we schedule time next week with the client to talk to them/have them screenshare?

Hey Frankie, Armando from my team noted that since this issue is isolated to just Add to Cart events, which is a known issue when the Rebuy plugin is present, bringing this to the attention of their Rebuy rep to step in and provide guidance has helped advertisers with this issue in the past. This is the path we recommend for next steps, in addition to disconnecting and reconnecting the Shopify Pixel if they haven't done so already/reaching out to Rebuy did not resolve the issue. From there, we can discuss hopping on a call, since frankly, I won't be able to help much from my end with this issue live.
Thank you - just passed this along! I THINK they are releasing makeup soon, so I want them to be on TikTok lol
For sure, lmk if they come back to us with anything!

Hi Joey! See below - 


Hi Frankie,

Wanted to confirm on our side that we've disconnected/reconnected the Shopify Pixel today.
Could you confirm on your end if you're still seeing issues with the data reporting on your end?

This issue seems to have started before we've even installed the Rebuy app so it's doubtful that it's causing the issue.
However, we can reach out to them regardless if reconnecting the pixel hasn't resolved the issue.

All the best,
Borna S.

items.content:
Hello! My client , Rhode, is using Shopify integration to run a pixel + events API on their website. They are looking to launch ASAP and I noticed their ATC event might not be tracking properly. 

I flagged to the client and they said the below - 

" I can step in for the add to cart tracking -- we are currently using the TikTok sales channel integration for pixels. Are there any additional custom tracking tags we need to add when using the sales channel integration?

Also wondering if there are any nuances for add to cart event tracking for tiktok - we've seen this issue with Google Analytics before where they are not able to properly track ATC events because our buy button did not say "add to cart" so we had to custom code that in. 

Please send over any documentation for this and we will take a look. "


is there a solve for this as they are using the shopify connection?
